name: undiplomatic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not typical of or suitable for diplomats (= officials whose job is to represent their country in another country, and who usually work in an embassy): This was an unprecedented use of undiplomatic language by the veteran diplomat.
acting in a way that might cause people to be upset, hurt, or annoyed : Nobody can accuse this book of being undiplomatic; the author is unfailingly kind. Related word
diplomaticSynonym
non-diplomatic
More examplesFewer examplesThe EU chief negotiator was blunt, even undiplomatic, about the missed deadlines.Somebody who has seen the letter said it was "very undiplomatic" and contained much criticism of Britain's performance.She often intimidated others with her undiplomatic manner and forceful opinions, but she gained the respect of fellow scientists for her outstanding research.He was surrounded by undiplomatic individuals who insisted on speaking their minds.
